vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
ἀδελφ-ή, ἡ,
feminine of ἀδελφός, sister, Trag., E [Refs 4th c.BC+]: Ionic dialect ἀδελφ-εή, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; Epic dialect ἀδελφ-ειή, [Refs 4th c.AD+]; Doric dialect ἀδελφ-εά, [Refs 5th c.BC+], and in lyr, passages of Trag., [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__2 kinswoman, [LXX]
__3 term of endearment, [LXX]; applied to a wife, [Refs 3rd c.BC+]:—sister (as a fellow Christian), [NT]
vocabInfos.shortDef: sister, fellow countrywoman; by extension a female believer, a sister in the family of faith
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
sister, fellow countrywoman; by extension a female believer, a sister in the family of faith
a sister; near kinswoman, fellow countrywoman or female relative
